author: markekraus
body:
## PR Summary

When a charset is not supplied for a JSON response, the default encoding should be UTF-8 per RFC 8259. This PR changes the default charset to UTF-8 for JSON responses when a charset is not defined.

I'm not sure if this is a breaking change or not. If someone was running into encoding issues, they would already be converting `BasicHtmlWebResponseObject.RawContentStream.` If they were unaware, then this would just correct characters in their strings.

Closes #5530

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I believe we should add the default in documentation.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Last question - is this a breaking change or not?

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @iSazonov I need someone more experienced to make that call. Normally, the changes I deal with are more black-and-white on being breaking changes. This one is a bit of grey. This certainly changes the public behavior of the cmdlets. However, as I said the the description anyone who ran into this behavior is likely using a work around that would be unaffected by the change. The only user story I can come up with where this is a breaking change is where someone was purposely using the broken encoding... that's not a compelling story to me.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I think that formally this can be considered an breaking change.
